name: Service Virtual Local Area Network
title: S-VLAN
definition: The identifier found within the service tag (commonly referred to in MEF as S-Tag) which is typically associated with OVC end points at an ENNI.
validEntryNotes: A single value may be entered or multiple four numeric S-VLANs are allowed to describe a non- contiguous list and/or ranges.
Based on customer/provider negotiations, if a provider does not require a reiteration of all existing S-VLANs that are to be retained, the existing S-VLANs are retained by default when not provided.
usageNotes: Prohibited when the associated NCI code specifies anything other than an S-VLAN based map.
Prohibited when the associated VPN-ID field is populated.
Required when the associated UACT field is “C” and the associated NCI code specifies an S-VLAN based map.
fieldNotes: This is the top tag in the stacked or Q in Q arrangement, or may be the sole identifier when customer frames are untagged (no underlying CE- VLAN).
This is usually provider assigned but may be negotiated between provider and customer.
When this field is populated, if the provider can not accommodate the requested value (s), it may be further negotiated between provider and customer.
When this field is blank and the associated NCI code specifies an S-VLAN based map, the value will be assigned by the provider.
When allowed by the provider product definition, S-VLANs may be specified in a range.
